best_practices_blueprint.description: Master Schema for Kit-Level Best Practices. Every Omega Kit (Website, App, API, Hive) MUST implement this XML structure to connect its specialized technical laws to the Brain.

section.name: Structural Laws
section.requirement: Define the project-specific "Rule of 3" variations (e.g., shard by feature vs. shard by type).
Explicitly define the "Sterile Zones" for production delivery.

section.name: Security & Authentication
section.requirement: Mandate specific libraries (e.g., jose, next-auth, supabase-auth-helpers).
Define the session-expiry and token-refresh methodology.
List non-negotiable sanitization patterns for high-risk inputs.

section.name: Performance & Optimization
section.requirement: Define Lighthouse/PageSpeed targets (Target: 90-100 across all metrics).
Mandate specific optimizations (e.g., LCP image preloading, critical CSS inlining, hydration matching).
Specify "Negative Practices" (e.g., no oversized libraries, no client-side heavy lifting in SSR).

section.name: UI/UX Aesthetics
section.requirement: Define the Design System tokens (Gradients, Glassmorphism, Typography).
Mandate micro-interaction standards (Hover effects, smooth transitions, feedback loops).
Accessibility Law: Minimum WCAG 2.2 AA coverage for all interactive elements.

section.name: Testing & Validation
section.requirement: Specify mandatory test types (Unit, Integration, E2E, Accessibility, Performance).
Define "Proof of Work" evidence requirements for test results.

protocol.name: Audit Enforcement
protocol.step: AI must scan for local `BEST_PRACTICES.xml` at session start.
AI must verify that the current task's output aligns with every REQUIREMENT in this Kit's file.
If a conflict occurs, Kit-Specific Laws OVERRIDE the Global Standards.
